description: Veterans Community Project (VCP) builds tiny home villages for homeless veterans, providing fully furnished homes (240-320 sq ft) with wraparound support services. Founded by combat veterans, VCP follows a unique model where veterans keep all furniture when transitioning to permanent housing.

villages.name: VCP Village Kansas City
villages.description: The original VCP Village, featuring 49 tiny homes for veterans experiencing homelessness. Each home is fully furnished with all utilities included. The campus includes a Village Center with fellowship hall, dental clinic, medical services, and veterinary services.

villages.name: VCP Village Longmont
villages.description: Located on a 2-acre property approximately 13 miles northeast of Boulder, the Longmont Village features 26 tiny houses including 5 family homes and a 3,000 sq ft Community Center. Broke ground in 2020 and completed in June 2025.

villages.name: VCP Village St. Louis
villages.description: Located on a nearly 4-acre property in the heart of the Jeff Vander-Lou neighborhood, the St. Louis campus includes a Village of 50 tiny houses for veterans experiencing homelessness and an Outreach Center for comprehensive support services.

villages.name: VCP Village Sioux Falls
villages.description: Located on a two-acre site in northwest Sioux Falls, this purpose-built community features 25 fully furnished tiny homes (15 single-person and 10 family units) paired with on-site wraparound support services. The first veterans moved in during October 2023.

villages.name: VCP Village Glendale
villages.description: VCP's Arizona village, located at 63rd and Grand Avenues in Glendale. Broke ground in February 2025 with anticipated completion in 2027. Will feature 50 tiny homes for veterans experiencing homelessness.

villages.name: VCP Village Milwaukee
villages.description: VCP's Wisconsin village, located on a 7-acre site on the northwest side of Milwaukee. Currently under construction, will feature 40 tiny homes for military veterans.
